38 sts photo 8 repeat row 1 to 12 four more times finishing turn your work so that the wrong side is facing you align the final row with the first row and going through stitches of both row join them together with a slip_stitch close the gap at the top of the hat with a few stitches turn your work right way around add a pompom if you wish to do so and wear proudly making it made to measure this pattern uses even number of stitches in each row i have allocated 8 stitches for the ribbing and 30 for the main part of the hat if you want to make shorter hat please reduct an even number of stitches from the main part of the hat you can measure your starting chain against a hat you already like the size of if that helps 3 if you are using lighter yarn dk or 4ply you may want to add some stitches for the ribbing part of the pattern if ribbing seems too short play around and have fun once you have worked out how many sts you need for the ribbing and how many sts for the hat part an even number you can follow the pattern as written ignoring the stitch counts note about ribbing i like to have the first/last stitch of the ribbing as a full single_crochet instead of blo single_crochet if you prefer you can make all the ribbing stitches into the back loops to work out the width for your hat measure the circumference of your head your hat should have 2-3 of negative ease my head is 23 and i made my hat approximately 20 wide before joining you may need less or more repeats in total than instructed in the pattern hope you enjoyed making this hat if you have any
